alert.note: Alert for Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 2:50AM EST until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and northern Florida, including the following counties, in northeast Florida, Flagler and Putnam. In northern Florida, Marion. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 246 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated 3 to 5 inches of rain have fallen across the warning area, except 5 to 6 inches across portions of Marion and Flagler counties. Flooding is imminent or ongoing in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Palm Coast, Ocala, Palatka, Rainbow Lakes Estates, Flagler Beach, Bunnell, Crescent City, Interlachen, Pomona Park, Salt Springs, Fort McCoy, Lynne, Juniper Springs, Citra, East Palatka, Andalusia, Lake Delancy, Orange Springs, Fruitland and Moss Bluff. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
